Description: Two people were killed and five others were injured when a shooting broke out at a New Year's Eve party.[442][443]
An argument in the Wolf Creek neighborhood escalated when a suspect opened fire, killing a man and injuring three others.[436]
Four men opened fire on a queue of people outside a music venue in the Jamaica neighborhood of Queens, wounding ten.[441]

2025 New Orleans truck attack: A man who was inspired by the Islamic State and is also believed to have planted bombs around the area, drove a rented truck through Bourbon Street in the French Quarter, attempting to strike revelers during New Year's celebrations. The man killed fourteen people and injured several dozen others with the truck before he crashed into a crane, after which he exited the vehicle and opened fire, striking five people, including two officers, before he was fatally shot by police.[437][438][439][440]
A dispute that escalated into a shooting wounded five, including the shooter, in the Eckington neighborhood of Northeast DC.[435]
An argument that escalated into a shooting injured four.[434]
A shooting at a large party south of Dubberly wounded six. The party was being hosted on private property without a permit and was charging entrance fees, and featured a DJ and performers.[433]
Five people were shot, one fatally, when a shooting broke out at an after-hours club in the Kountze Place neighborhood of the north side.[432]
An apparent argument over drugs led to a shooting that left two men dead and two other men wounded in the North Shore neighborhood.[431]
A man fatally shot his wife and 2-year-old daughter and injured his 9-year-old and 13-year-old daughters at their home before he was shot and killed by police.[430]
One person was killed and five others were injured when an altercation between two people at a gathering escalated into a shooting.[429]
A man was killed and three others were injured in a targeted shooting inside a Slim Chickens restaurant just northeast of Union University.[428]
Four people, including a juvenile, were wounded when someone opened fire on them as they sat in a car together in the Whittier neighborhood.[427]
Five people were injured in a suspected drive-by shooting outside a Yoshinoya restaurant in the Westlake neighborhood. One of the suspects was also wounded.[425][426]

Officers responding to a suicide-in-progress call from a man's family member at an apartment in the Far North Central area were fired upon by the man, leaving seven officers injured, most with shrapnel wounds. After several hours of the man being barricaded inside the apartment, officers found him dead inside after midnight.[424]

A fight at a basketball game that soon escalated into a targeted shooting outside of school killed a woman and injured three others, including two children who were grazed by bullets, in the Mid-Govans neighborhood of North Baltimore.[423]
A shooting in the Maysville neighborhood left four people wounded. After the suspect turned himself in at the jail, a wounded teenager later died.[422]

Four people were wounded in a targeted shooting in the Orange Mound neighborhood, in which three suspects got out of a vehicle and opened fire on the occupants of another vehicle near a community center.[421]
Five people, including one targeted person, were injured when a shooting between two groups broke out at a pub.[419]

An altercation that later escalated into a drive-by shooting outside a nightclub injured nine, one fatally. The suspected shooter, a driver, and a passenger were arrested, the latter just for public intoxication.[420]

A man walked into a Martin’s Super Market and attempted to kidnap a 19-year-old employee. As a manager attempted to calm the suspect, he shot and killed the employee and fired at random people nearby, killing a customer. The shooter ran to a nearby apartment complex, where he shot at and wounded two police officers before the officers killed him.[417][418]
A shooting at a ballroom in the Frankford neighborhood of Northeast Philadelphia killed a man and injured three others.[416]
An employee at a plumbing business in the Puerto Nuevo neighborhood shot and killed four co-workers before killing himself.[415]
A shooting at a home in the College Park neighborhood just north of LeMoyne-Owen College killed two and injured three others.[414]
Two men were killed and five others, including a juvenile, were wounded in a shooting at Athens Park.[413]
A man opened fire when a domestic dispute escalated north of Clatskanie, killing one person and wounding three others. One of the wounded fired back and killed the shooter.[412]
One person was killed and three others were injured when a fight between two people inside the club escalated into a shooting near the Rittersville neighborhood.[411]
An employee of a warehouse opened fire on coworkers, killing one and injuring five others. One of the injured died two days later.[409] The suspect was later arrested at a home in Columbus.[410]

During an armed robbery at a gas station south of Quincy, a man shot and killed two people and injured two others before fleeing and setting off a manhunt. The man was spotted by officers in Columbia County the following day, and they began a pursuit which ended in a crash just northwest of Live Oak in Suwannee County, where the robber shot and wounded a Suwannee County deputy before he was shot and killed by police.[407][408]
Four men showed up to Grady Memorial Hospital with gunshot wounds. Police later determined that they had been shot in the Lakewood Heights neighborhood of south Atlanta.[406]
One man was killed and five others, including two teens, were wounded in a shooting.[404]
Four men were shot at an apartment in east Raleigh.[403]
Two teenagers were killed and two others were injured in an ambush attack at an apartment complex near the Columbus neighborhood of east Tulsa.[405]
A teenager was killed and six men were wounded when a suspect opened fire at a house party while being escorted out in the Woodland Hills neighborhood.[402]
A mother shot and killed her three daughters and mortally wounded her other daughter inside a home. She called the police before shooting herself, and she later died at a hospital.[400][401]
A drive-by shooting killed a person and left three others wounded.[399]
Two children were killed in a shooting that injured a third child and three adults.[398]
A shooting during a gathering at an apartment wounded four people.[396]
Five people were wounded in a shooting in northwest Roanoke.[397]
During a car meet-up, unidentified suspects attempted to rob a 16-year-old boy, which then escalated into a shooting that wounded him and three other teenagers and killed a 20-year-old man.[395]
Four people were shot, one fatally, in the College Hills neighborhood.[394]
A dispute between three men in the Black Oak neighborhood escalated into a shooting, leaving the three men injured. A 10-year-old boy was struck by a stray bullet inside his home.[393]

Police officers responding to a home for a welfare check found five people, two adults and three children, shot to death inside. It was later determined that one of the adults had shot the other four before killing himself.[392]

UPMC Memorial Hospital shooting: A man armed with a pistol and carrying zip ties entered UPMC Memorial Hospital's intensive care unit and took staff members hostage. Responding police officers opened fire as the man held a female staff member at gunpoint, beginning a shoot-out in which the man and a police officer were killed and three staff members and two other police officers were wounded. A fourth staff member was injured while fleeing.[391]

A fight between two groups of people in the La Bajada neighborhood of West Dallas killed three and injured two others when it escalated into a shooting. Shortly afterwards, another shooting happened near the Children's Medical Center Dallas in the Southwestern Medical District and was reportedly connected to the first incident.[390]
A shooting outside a home that stemmed from a dispute left a man dead and three others injured in the South of Main neighborhood of east Columbus.[389]
An argument during a party after a trail ride escalated when a suspect opened fire, wounding six females, some of whom were teenagers in the Sardis area south of Selma.[388]
Four people were shot outside a restaurant in North Hayward.[387]
A shooting that broke out at a nightclub injured four.[384]
A shooting at a bar in the MacGregor neighborhood, in which the suspect appeared to fire at random on patrons as the bar closed, left five people injured.[386]
A shooting killed a man and injured three others.[385]
During Mardi Gras festivities and while Chris Ardoin performed on stage, at least one person opened fire, killing two and injuring twelve others.[382]
An argument during a pickup basketball game escalated into a shooting that killed two men and injured two others.[383]
Four people were shot outside a bar in North Huntsville.[381]
A man was killed and three other men were injured when a fight at a park escalated.[380]

An argument at a liquor store in the Back of the Yards neighborhood escalated when a man and a woman opened fire on another group, injuring four. A person in the other group returned fire and wounded the man.[379]
Two people were killed and two people were injured in a shooting in Downtown Shreveport.[378]
A fight in the parking lot of a venue hosting a party escalated into a shooting, which wounded four.[377]

A man out on bond opened fire at an apartment complex near Savannah, striking multiple buildings and vehicles and wounding five people. Later that day, the suspect crashed a car and ran from Savannah police before being arrested.[376]

A man shot his ex-wife and his teenage son at his home in Selma before driving into the surrounding county, allegedly to attack other people at random. The man shot and grazed a man in the head before running the victim over with his vehicle, then pistol-whipped a woman after his gun jammed when he attempted to shoot her, before shooting an elderly woman in her yard who was on her phone before bludgeoning her to death with the engine block of his vehicle because he believed she was calling the police. After killing his last victim, the man tried to force his way into her home, where other people were present, before he was arrested.[375]
A man was killed and three others were wounded in a shooting at a Red Roof Inn.[371]

A confrontation between two groups at a car meetup escalated into a shooting during a large gathering at Young Park, killing three men and injuring fifteen others. Four suspects, a 20-year-old man and three teens, ages 17 and 15, were taken into custody.[374]
Four men were shot, one fatally, inside an apartment.[373]
A drive-by shooting killed a teenage boy and injured four others, including at least one other teenager.[372]
Four people, including two teenage boys, were wounded when shots were fired at a trail ride event.[370]
A man was killed and seven others were injured in a shooting at the site of a Saint Patrick's Day parade after the conclusion of festivities.[369]
An argument at an after-hours nightclub in the Gulfton neighborhood escalated into a shooting when a man fired shots into the entrance of the club, wounding six men.[368]
A man opened fire at an apartment complex, killing a woman, an infant, two toddlers, and injuring a 10-year-old girl before mortally wounding himself.[367]
A street fight outside of a house party escalated into a shooting that left two juveniles dead and four others injured.[366]
Four people, including a teenager, were shot in the Oakenshawe neighborhood.[365]

At an event venue southeast of Orangeburg, a man who was out on bond for an armed robbery and had disabled his ankle monitor was suspected of firing into a crowd, wounding seven. In the subsequent chaos, three other people were injured.[364]
Seven people were shot in a drive-by shooting. One of the injured died of her injuries a month later.[360]
Four people were shot in the Bayview neighborhood.[361]
Four people were shot shortly after midnight in Downtown Austin.[363]
In the parking lot of a pub, a domestic situation escalated into a shooting that killed two and injured three. Four of the victims were shot when they attempted to intervene in the incident.[362]
A fight on the patio of a bar in the Vance neighborhood escalated when a person in the parking lot opened fire, striking four people. One of the victims returned fire and killed the shooter.[359]
A 29-year-old man fatally shot his mother in her car before exiting and opening fire on passing cars, killing one person and injuring two others, before killing himself.[358]
Four people were shot in the parking lot of a pub after midnight.[357]
A shooting killed two men and injured two others.[356]
A shooting killed a man and injured four others.[355]

During an illegal gun sale in a neighborhood south of Fredericksburg, four teen suspects opened fire, killing three and injuring two others. A witness to the robbery opened fire on one of the suspects, wounding a 16-year-old suspect.[353][354]
A shooting during a meeting for a community violence intervention program in a business park left one man dead and five others injured.[352]
Six men were shot outside a barber shop just west of Edison High School.[351]
A shooting during a gathering to raise money at a Shell gas station north of Barrett killed one and injured six others, including at least one teenager.[350]
A man was killed and four others were injured in a shooting at Fairground Park in the Fairground neighborhood.[345]

As officers directed a large crowd in the Central Business District leaving French Quarter Festival, a person opened fire and wounded five before fleeing. The suspect was arrested by officers a block away from the attack.[347][348]
Two people were killed and nine others were injured in a shooting at Fifth Avenue Park.[346]
A shooting during an overnight party in a parking lot killed one and injured three others.[349]

A student let an armed student into Wilmer-Hutchins High School through a locked side door. Moments later, the 17-year-old male suspect opened fire, striking four male students in a hallway before fleeing, but later that same day, the suspect turned himself in. One other student suffered a non-gunshot injury when he fell, and investigators believe the suspect was targeting a specific student over a dispute.[343][344]

2025 Florida State University shooting: Two food service employees were killed, and at least six others, including the shooter, were injured in a shooting in the area of the student union building at Florida State University.[342]
Three children and an adult were shot at an apartment complex. A 15-year-old died at the hospital from their injuries. No arrests have been made.[341]
Five people were shot and injured, including two critically, in a drive-by shooting in the Medical District. One of the victims later succumbed to their injuries.[340]
Four people were injured, two critically, in a drive-by shooting outside of a bar in southeast Houston.[339]
A dispute between family members led to a shooting in the parking lot of a barber shop which killed a man and injured five others.[338]
A man opened fire during an altercation with multiple people before being fatally shot by a responding officer. Eleven people were injured, including one who was injured by police gunfire.[336][337]
Five people were shot, one fatally, at a Mexican restaurant in the Parkway Village neighborhood.[334]

A shooting after the conclusion of a day of a week-long celebration left a man dead and four others injured at Elizabeth City State University. The deceased man was not a student of the school, and three of the wounded victims were students, while two others were injured in the subsequent commotion.[335]
Two armed men are suspected of traveling to confront a group of people and then opening fire, killing a teenage boy and injuring three others.[333]
Five people were shot in the head in the Midtown Phillips neighborhood, four of whom who died.[331] A member of the Native Mob was charged with shooting the victims.[332]
A shooting inside a nightclub wounded four.[330]
A person opened fire during an argument with two groups outside of a Foot Locker store, killing two and wounding two others.[329]
A man was killed and three others were wounded in a shooting in the South End of Little Rock.[328]
Four people were shot in a bar.[322]
Four people were shot in the Union Station neighborhood of Downtown Denver.[323]
During a family party in southeast Houston, an uninvited guest who was asked to leave opened fire, killing an 18-year-old and injuring fifteen others. Others at the party returned fire.[326][327]

Multiple people began shooting into a large crowd during a fight with semi-automatic pistols in Downtown Tulsa. A shooter was killed while at least six others, including another shooter, suffered injuries.[325]
Multiple shooters opened fire at a steakhouse next door to the police headquarters, killing three people and injuring five others.[324]
One person was killed and three others, two critically, were injured in an afternoon shooting in the Montclaire South neighborhood.[321]
A fight broke out inside a bar in the Midtown neighborhood. At some point, an individual pulled out a gun and opened fire, injuring seven people.[320]
Four teens were shot at a house party.[319]
A man killed a woman and injured three others, including his girlfriend, after a domestic dispute escalated at an apartment complex. He was later found dead in the trailer park.[318]
Two men were killed and three others were injured after a fight that escalated broke out in a sports bar in the Frayser neighborhood.[317]
Multiple shooters opened fire in an "ambush style" at an outdoor dice game, injuring four people.[316]
Two people were killed and three others, including an 11-year-old girl who was grazed by a bullet, were injured in a shooting in the Brightmoor neighborhood.[315]
Four children were injured in a shooting on a SEPTA bus in Fairmount Park.[314]
Two men were killed and two others, including a juvenile, were injured when a gun battle erupted at a neighborhood intersection.[313]
Two women and two children were shot.[312]
One person was killed and six others were injured in a shooting during a fight in the parking lot of a nightclub.[311]
Four people, including two teens, were shot following an argument over a charging cable.[310]
Four people, including a teenager, were injured in a drive-by shooting in the Homan Square neighborhood.[308]
A gunman opened fire at a gym, killing one man and injuring three others, before being shot and killed by responding police officers.[309]
A group of men opened fire during a small party at a house, killing a 44-year-old man and critically injuring three other men.[306]
Three people were killed and one man was critically injured in a shooting at a nightclub in Downtown Seattle.[307]
Three people were killed and six others were injured in a shooting at a bar.[305]
Four people were found fatally shot inside an apartment building in Carondelet.[304]
Four people were found injured at an apartment building.[303]
A man shot four people outside a sports bar following a dispute.[302]
A 16-year-old boy was killed and five others were injured in a shooting at a house party.[301]
A physical altercation between two groups escalated into a shooting that left four injured near Ellis Square.[300]
Six people were injured, including one critically, after an argument with multiple people escalated near Mitchell High School.[299]
Seven people were shot, including juveniles, at Kate Campbell Robertson Memorial Park.[298]

Ten people were shot due to an altercation on a docked charter boat in the Intracoastal Waterway and in a marina. One other person suffered a non-gunshot injury as a result of the incident. Additionally, a North Myrtle Beach police officer accidentally shot himself while responding to the scene.[297]
Four people were shot in the Arlandria neighborhood over a dispute.[296]
Two people were killed and nine others, including three juveniles, were injured in a shooting at Fairmount Park.[295]
Five people were wounded in a suspected targeted attack at Brass Mill Center.[294]
Four men were shot at a gas station in southwest Atlanta.[292]
Seven people were wounded in a shooting at Harry Todd Park while hundreds of people were in attendance.[291]
A shooting killed a 19-year-old man and wounded three others.[293]

Officers responded to a shooting at a home southwest of Haubstadt where they encountered a male suspect, who surrendered to them. Three people were killed and another person was critically injured in the home.[290]
Two people were killed and two others were injured in a shooting south of Marion.[289]

Four people were injured in a shootout during a party at an apartment complex. It was initially reported there were five injuries, but a victim was counted at a hospital twice. Two suspects who are not adults were arrested.[288]
Seven teenagers were shot in a drive-by shooting on a crowd at an after-prom party at a house on the South Side near Saint Sabina Church.[287]
Six people were shot, one fatally, during the Fayette Festival.[286]
Four teenagers were shot at Briscoe Park.[285]
A woman was killed in a vehicle and five others were injured in a shooting at Boom Island Park in the St. Anthony West neighborhood. Another woman suffered a non-gunshot injury.[280]

After a man was denied entry to a bar in Downtown Asheville for harassing a group of women, he retrieved a firearm from his vehicle and engaged in a scuffle with a bouncer and a patron who attempted to aid the bouncer. The man then opened fire, and the patron returned fire, killing the man. Four people were struck by gunfire in the exchange.[281][282]
One person was killed and eleven others were injured, one critically and ten seriously, in a shooting at a house party in the early morning south of Mountain View.[284]
A suspected exchange of gunfire between the occupants of a car and a gathering killed a man inside the vehicle and wounded four.[283]
Seven people were shot in the Wheatley Place neighborhood.[279]
A man was killed and three others were injured in a shooting inside a home hosting a house party in the Elmwood Park neighborhood.[278]

Four people were shot, one fatally, outside a food store in the Hampton Heights neighborhood. Minutes later, another shooting on the same street killed one and wounded another, but it is unclear if the attacks were connected.[277]
Five people were wounded in a shooting near the town hall.[276]
An altercation that escalated into a gunfight at a bar left six injured, including two suspects.[275]
A shooting during a graduation party at a home wounded four, including two minors.[274]
Six people were injured in a shooting during a house party.[273]
Seven teens were injured when gunshots erupted during drag racing in the Lee-Miles neighborhood.[272]
A 19-year-old man was killed and six others were wounded in a shooting.[271]
Four people were wounded in a shooting near the Deer District in Downtown Milwaukee.[270]
A man was killed and three others were injured in a shooting in the Trinidad neighborhood of Northeast DC.[269]
Four people were found shot in the lobby of an apartment building in the Summerville neighborhood.[268]
Four people were shot during a cookout in the Greenfield-Grand River neighborhood.[267]
A shooting at an apartment complex in the Magnolia Gardens neighborhood killed an 18-year-old and wounded three others, including at least one juvenile.[266]

2025 shootings of Minnesota legislators: A suspect believed to be posing as a police officer shot state senator John Hoffman and his wife at their home in Champlin during the early morning hours. Officers then conducted a welfare check on state senator Melissa Hortman at her home in Brooklyn Park because she lived nearby. They found the suspect at Hortman's home; he exchanged gunfire with them before fleeing. Hortman and her husband were both found shot and died from their injuries.[264] The Hortman's dog was also shot and was later euthanized.[265]
A man was killed and four others were injured when multiple people opened fire on them as they stood outside a house.[263]
An 18-year-old was killed and four others, including two juveniles, were injured in a shooting on a road south of Truckee Meadows Community College.[262]
Six people were shot when a suspect opened fire from a vehicle in Downtown Columbus on a gathering of people.[261]

An argument between a woman and her boyfriend as they drove to visit family in Nashville escalated when the boyfriend allegedly attempted to crash the vehicle before opening fire on her and her five children, striking her and four of her children. The man then allegedly chased her as she ran for help, but was taken into custody. The woman's 4-year-old child was killed.[260]
A woman was killed and four others were injured in a shooting in the parking lot of a BP gas station on the East Side.[259]
Four people were wounded in a shooting shortly before midnight.[258]
An argument inside a Caribbean American Society building in the Upper Albany neighborhood escalated when two groups opened fire on each other, wounding five.[253]
A person was killed and eleven others were injured when multiple people opened fire.[257]
Four people were wounded at a bar in an unincorporated enclave inside of Canton.[256]

Three people were killed, including an infant, and two others were injured when a 16-year-old pulled out a gun after an argument and opened fire on a group of people at WestFest. The suspect was shot at by police but was not struck and was taken into custody.[254][255]
Two men were killed inside vehicles and two others were injured in a shooting in the Little Haiti neighborhood.[252]
A fight during a block party in the St. Clair–Superior neighborhood escalated into a shooting that killed a man and injured five others.[251]
A man was killed and three others were injured when shots were fired at patrons as they left a bar as it closed.[250]
Four adults were shot in the Walker's Point neighborhood.[249]
A man was killed and three others were injured in a drive-by shooting south of Louisville.[248]
After a party was broken up by police officers, the partygoers moved to a parking lot in the Riverview neighborhood where multiple shooters opened fire, wounding at least four.[247]
A 19-year-old woman was killed and four other teenagers were wounded in a shooting in the Northridge neighborhood.[246]
Six teenagers were shot in a parking lot during a social gathering.[241]
Five people were injured, including four teenagers, when shots were fired at an abandoned warehouse being used for a party. Two others suffered non-gunshot injuries while fleeing the gunfire.[242]
A man was killed under an overpass and seven others were injured in a shooting during Juneteenth celebrations in the area of the Greenwood District and Oklahoma State University–Tulsa.[243]
A woman was killed and nine others were injured in a shooting when a fight at a Juneteenth celebration escalated west of Anderson.[245]
Four people were shot at Sibrie Park just east of Dr. Ronald E. McNair Elementary.[244]

A fight among of group of women at a nightclub escalated when a group of men intervened and began exchanging gunfire with each other in the parking lot. A police officer exchanged gunfire with a gunman, but neither was injured. A woman was killed and five others were injured during the shootout.[240]
A man was killed and three others, including two teenagers, were wounded in a shooting at a park just north of Detroit.[239]
A man was killed and four others were wounded in a shooting in the Wendell Phillips neighborhood.[238]
Four people were shot at an apartment complex in Downtown Springfield.[237]
At least five people were struck by gunfire and around ten other people were treated for graze wounds or injuries from falling in the East Liberty neighborhood.[236]
Four people were shot, including three teenagers, in a drive-by shooting in the Carrollton Ridge neighborhood.[235]
Four people were shot in the area of the Edmondson Avenue Historic District.[235]
A teenager was killed and four others were injured in a shooting in the Roseville neighborhood.[234]
A fight after a basketball game at a Baptist church led to a shooting in the parking lot, which injured four.[233]
A drive-by shooting killed a man and injured three others, including a teenage girl, in Central West Trenton.[232]

A shooting outside an event center in the Centennial neighborhood left four injured, including a 15-year-old boy. A 16-year-old boy was arrested in connection for the shooting after he was identified by witnesses when he was located hiding inside a shed in the Glenfair neighborhood.[231]
Four people were wounded in a shooting in the parking lot of a strip mall in the North Oaks neighborhood.[227]
A shooting during a house party in the Little Woods neighborhood left four people wounded.[230]
A shooting killed a man and wounded three others in the East Community neighborhood on the East Side.[229]
A shooting during a house party killed a person and wounded four others in the Roanoke neighborhood.[228]
A drive-by shooting wounded the four occupants of another vehicle, causing them to crash, in the Lyons Park neighborhood.[226]
Two boys were killed and another two were wounded in a shooting at an apartment complex.[225]
Five people were wounded when shots were fired during a block party in the Greenville neighborhood.[223][224]
Four people were injured inside a vehicle, including two children, in a drive-by shooting.[222]
2025 Chicago shooting: A drive-by shooting occurred outside a restaurant holding a rapper's album release party in the River North neighborhood. Four people were killed and 14 were hospitalized.[221]
Five people were wounded in a shooting in the Riverdale neighborhood on the Far South Side.[219][220]
Four men were injured when at least two people opened fire on them as they stood near a sidewalk in the West Englewood neighborhood.[218]
Four people were wounded when shots were fired into their apartment in the Summerhill neighborhood.[217]
Four people were injured in a shooting during an Independence Day block party in the Southern Dayton View neighborhood.[211]

At the end of Independence Day celebrations, an altercation in the Center Square/Hudson–Park Historic District area led to a person firing a handgun, striking four people, including a teenager, and another person firing a flaregun that started a structure fire. A responding officer was also injured when they were struck by a vehicle that was hit by an ambulance.[212]
Seven people were injured when at least two men approached them and opened fire in the Back of the Yards neighborhood.[215]
Five people, including two teenagers and two young children, were shot in the Fifeville neighborhood.[214]
During an overnight house party in the Southern Orchards neighborhood, a shooting killed a teenager and wounded five others, including another teenager.[216]
A suspected gang-related shooting wounded four in the Vermont Vista neighborhood.[213]

A fight in a parking lot under a bridge in the Deep Ellum neighborhood escalated into a shooting that killed a man and injured four others. An armed man, who has not yet been charged, was shot by police after police allege he ran towards responding police officers with his gun pointed towards them.[195][196]
A shooting at a park killed one person and injured five others.[197]

Officers conducting a welfare check on a woman at the request of her grandmother found four people shot to death in an apartment leased by the woman's boyfriend.[198] On July 22, a man was taken into custody and charged with four counts of capital murder for the shooting.[199]
Four men were wounded in a drive-by shooting in the Kalihi neighborhood.[200]
A man was killed and three others, including a teenager, was injured in a shooting in the Near North Riverfront neighborhood.[201]
One person was killed and four others were injured in a shooting in the Hunters Point neighborhood.[202]
Four teenagers were shot, one killed, in the West Central area of Downtown Fort Wayne.[205]
Four men were injured in a drive-by shooting as they sat in a vehicle together in the Little Village neighborhood.[204]

A fight at a gas station escalated when a man opened fire in a crowd, wounding five people, but a responding police officer allegedly shot the man when he aimed the gun at the crowd again while fleeing before fatally shooting him as he reached for the gun after he was initially shot.[203]
Eight people, two critically, were injured when a shooting broke out at a bar in the Passyunk Square neighborhood of South Philadelphia.[210]
Two people, including a juvenile, were killed and five others, including two other juveniles, were injured in a shooting in Downtown Indianapolis.[209]
A man was killed and five others were wounded in a shooting at the Shoppes at Buckeye in Buckeye–Woodhill.[207]
A fight during an Independence Day party escalated into a shooting that injured six people.[206]
Four teens and a middle-aged adult were shot in the Arbor Hill neighborhood.[208]
A shooting outside a bar killed two people and wounded two others.[194]
A teenager was killed and five others were injured in a shooting.[193]
Four young men were shot in the Haddington neighborhood of West Philadelphia.[190]

A group of more than 100 people partied in the parking lot of Mason Community Learning Center, an elementary school in the Middlebury neighborhood, after getting kicked out of a Waffle House in Springfield Township. During the party, a shooting began that wounded five people, including at least one teenager, and ten others were injured when they were struck by vehicles as people fled the attack.[189]
Four people were shot in the Broadway-Manchester neighborhood.[188]

A gunfight between multiple suspects in the Grays Ferry neighborhood killed three people and wounded nine others, including two juveniles.[191] One person was injured when they were trampled by people fleeing the attack.[192]

A man is suspected to have shot and killed a woman in her home in Rupert before driving to Burley where he shot and killed two people inside another home. After the man was arrested, officers were asked to check behind a café in Heyburn where they found a man dead from a gunshot wound inside a vehicle. All four people are believed to have been shot by the same man.[187]
Five people were shot in the South Side of Easton.[183]
Four people were shot during a Tyner Academy class reunion being hosted at a convention center.[186]
Two people were killed and three others were injured when shots were fired outside a bar in Downtown Milwaukee.[185]
Two people were killed and two others were injured in a shooting at an apartment complex.[184]
A drive-by shooting outside a nightclub in the Golfcrest / Bellfort / Reveille neighborhood of Southeast Houston killed two people and wounded fifteen others.[180]

2025 Lexington shootings: A man shot a state trooper near Blue Grass Airport during a traffic stop before hijacking a vehicle and driving to a church where he shot four people, killing two women and injuring two men. Responding officers shot and killed the man at the church.[181]
One person was killed and five others were injured in a shooting in Uptown Charlotte.[182]
Four people, including a teenage boy, were struck by gunfire in the Belmont neighborhood in the Bronx.[179]
A shooting killed a football player for the Ole Miss Rebels and injured four others just east of Memphis in the Cordova area.[177]
Four people were injured in a shooting at an apartment complex in Downtown Little Rock.[176]
Four teenagers were shot, one fatally, during an unauthorized block party in the Lee–Miles neighborhood.[175]
A shooting in South Chicago killed a man and injured three others.[178]
Four men were shot when they were reportedly attacked by three armed men in the Austin neighborhood.[174]
A drive-by shooting wounded five people.[173]
A shooting at an apartment complex killed one man and injured three others.[172]
A 17-year-old boy was killed and five others were injured in a shooting at Empire Park in the Glenrose Heights neighborhood.[171]

A shooting during a graduation party in the Stanton neighborhood wounded four people, including two children and their mother, and a man who happened to be passing by the party at the time of the incident.[170]
Four people were injured in a shooting in the LoDo neighborhood.[167]
Four juveniles were shot in a suspected gang-related attack.[168]
Two men were killed and two others, a mother and her 7-year-old girl, were injured in a shooting in the Nicetown–Tioga neighborhood.[169]
A shooting during an unsanctioned event killed two people and injured five others less than an hour after midnight.[166]
Five people were injured in a shooting in northeast Indianapolis, four of whom were in a vehicle at the time of the attack.[165]
Four teenagers were injured in a shooting in the West Garfield Park neighborhood.[164]
A confrontation at a streetcar stop in the Sweet Auburn neighborhood escalated into a shooting that killed a man and injured ten others.[163]
An altercation that escalated into a shooting killed a man and injured four others.[162]

A man opened fire in the valet area of Grand Sierra Resort, killing two men and injuring three other men, before fleeing through the parking lot where he encountered a security guard who he exchanged gunfire with. After this, the man shot and killed another man driving by in the parking lot before responding police officers shot and wounded him.[159][160] The man died in the hospital three days after the shooting.[161]
A man and a woman were killed and two other women were injured in a shooting at a Marathon gas station in the Martin Park neighborhood.[158]

2025 Midtown Manhattan shooting: A man opened fire inside 345 Park Avenue in Midtown Manhattan, killing a New York City Police Department officer and a woman before spraying the lobby with gunfire. The man then shot a security officer and another man in the lobby before taking an elevator to the 33rd floor of the building where he killed another person before fatally shooting himself.[156] Investigators believe the man was attempting to target the headquarters of the National Football League, but took the wrong elevator.[157]

Four people were found shot to death northeast of Tiptonville.[153] The suspect, who was dating a relative of the victims, allegedly abandoned a baby of two of the victims in a yard in Dyer County after the killings and was later arrested in Jackson after a seven-day manhunt after he was discovered hiding in a vacant pool house.[154][155]
At least one person opened fire at a recreation center in the Cobbs Creek neighborhood, injuring five people, among whom were two children and two teenagers.[152]
Four people were injured in a shooting at an apartment complex in the Scotts Crossing neighborhood.[151]

A teenager was killed and five others, including at least one other teenager, were injured in a shooting at a nightclub during informal "Prep Week" festivities ahead of the next semester of university. Several of the victims, not including the deceased teen, were students at various universities.[150]

2025 Anaconda shooting: A man is suspected of opening fire at a bar next door to where he lived, killing four people, before fleeing and sparking a manhunt.[148] The suspect was captured seven days later.[149]
A drug deal gone wrong resulted in a shooting that killed a man and injured three others in the Westwood neighborhood.[147]
Seven people were injured when a shooting at a liquor store broke out near the Bedford Place neighborhood.[146]
Two people opened fire during a party, injuring five people, including a 4-year-old child, before another partygoer returned fire, killing one and injuring the other.[145]
Four people were shot in a residential area.[144]
A shooting at an Advance Auto Parts killed a 14-year-old boy and wounded another, and adjacent to the store at a Texaco gas station, two other people were shot.[143]
Four people were injured in an early morning shooting.[142]
Two people were killed and six others were injured when a shooting at an unauthorized after-party for a festival broke out in the Fashion District of Downtown Los Angeles.[141]
Six people were shot at a public housing complex.[140]
A sergeant for the U.S. Army is accused of opening fire at Fort Stewart and wounding five service members.[139]
A large street brawl escalated into a shooting that wounded four people.[137]
Six people, including a 5-year-old girl, were shot in the Park Heights neighborhood. A man who was critically injured later died.[136]
Four people, including two teenage boys, were shot in the West Garfield Park neighborhood.[135]
A woman was killed and five others, including three teens, were injured in a shooting in the South Austin neighborhood.[134]
Eight people were injured when a shooting near a nightclub broke out in the Fondren neighborhood.[133]
Five people were wounded in a shooting in the Grand Boulevard area of the Bronzeville neighborhood.[132]
A man is suspected of shooting and killing his wife and their three children aged from 7 to 11 at their home west of Merlin before killing himself.[131]
Four people were shot in the Martindale–Brightwood neighborhood.[130]
Four people were shot in the Near West Side neighborhood.[129]
Five people were injured in a shooting during a large party southeast of Grandview.[128]
A teenager was killed and four others were injured in a shooting at a dragstrip southwest of Prentiss.[124]
Five people were shot after a street gathering descended into gunfire. One of the gunshot victims was also struck by a vehicle.[125]

A dispute at a bar in the Crown Heights neighborhood of Brooklyn escalated into a gang-related shootout that killed three men and injured 11 others. Two of the dead, one of whom was affiliated with Folk Nation, were a part of the shootout while two other gunmen escaped.[127]
A man was killed and three others were injured in a shooting at an apartment complex in the Southwood neighborhood.[126]
A man shot at four people in a carport, killing a man and injuring the other three, before entering his home next door and killing himself.[122][123]
Four teenagers were shot in the Westchester Square neighborhood of the Bronx.[121]
Two teenagers were killed while another teenager and a man were injured in a shooting at an apartment complex.[120]
A shooting during a basketball tournament being held in a park in the Baychester neighborhood of the Bronx killed a man and injured four others, including a teenage girl.[119]
Four men were shot and injured in the early morning.[118]
An argument in a Downtown Kansas City parking lot escalated into a shooting that killed two men and injured three others, including a juvenile.
Four people were shot at a bar overnight.[117]
Five people were shot outside a market in the Vermont Knolls neighborhood.[116]
A shooting in the Phillips West neighborhood behind Cristo Rey Jesuit High School killed a man and injured six others.[115]

Annunciation Catholic Church shooting: A person opened fire in the Windom neighborhood through the windows of Church of the Annunciation at the beginning of morning Mass, killing two children sitting in the church pews and injuring 27 others, 24 of whom were children. Another person suffered a non-gunshot injury.[113] The shooter then died by suicide.[114]
Four people were shot at a fire department's recreation hall during a party being hosted there.[112]
Two men were killed and two others were injured in a shooting.[109]
A shooting killed a man and injured four others.[110]
Seven people were shot during a drive-by shooting when at least one gunman opened fire on a crowd in Bronzeville.[111]
Four people were shot during a drive-by shooting in the West Town neighborhood.[108]
Five people, including a juvenile, were found injured by gunfire in Bronzeville.[107]

A gunman in a vehicle opened fire on a group of men outside a deli in the Allerton section of the Bronx, killing one man and injuring four other men. After the shooting, the suspect sustained injuries after he collided with a stalled van a few blocks away from the scene.[106]
Five people were injured in a shooting at an apartment complex in the Hyde Park neighborhood.[105]
An overnight shooting killed one person and wounded three others.[104]

A customer at a bar east of Plum Grove fetched a firearm from his vehicle and opened fire, killing a man and injuring five others before escaping.[102] One man succumbed to his injuries a day later.[103]
A fight at a bar escalated into a shooting that wounded six, including two teenagers and the suspect, in the Flats neighborhood.[101]
Four juveniles were shot, aged 3 to 15, in the Hickory Hill neighborhood by suspects clad in ski masks and black clothing.[100]
A gang-related shooting killed a 13-year-old boy and injured three other teenagers in the Santa Anita neighborhood.[99]
A shooting during a marijuana event in the India Basin neighborhood wounded six people.[98]
A 17-year-old boy was killed and five men were wounded in an overnight shooting outside an apartment complex in the Northeast Tampa neighborhood.[97]
Four men were injured in a shooting in the Englewood neighborhood.[96]
Five men were injured in a shooting at a homeless encampment in the area of Lyndale and Whittier, including one critically.[94] One man succumbed to his injuries five days later.[95]

A woman was fatally wounded, and six others were injured in a shooting at a homeless encampment in the Longfellow neighborhood. The shooting happened on a property where the property owner had allowed homeless residents to camp on the property in protest of the perceived failure of city officials to address the homelessness crisis in the city.[93]

2025 North Codorus Township shooting: A man ambushed police officers investigating the property of a woman south of Spring Grove who reported that an ex-boyfriend was stalking and harassing her. Upon opening the front door of a farmhouse, the man opened fire, killing three police officers and wounding two others. An injured officer managed to return fire and kill the shooter. Investigators also discovered that the ex-girlfriend's family dog had been fatally shot by the man before their arrival.[92]
Three teenagers and child were injured in a shooting at an apartment complex in the Peoplestown neighborhood.[91]
A late night shooting killed two people and injured two others, including a teenager.[90]

Five people, including a child, were fired upon by at least one occupant of another vehicle on Interstate 10 near the Interstate 95 split. A man was killed and three of them were wounded, but the child escaped uninjured.[89]
Four people, including a teenage boy, were injured in a shooting at a grocery store in the Lincoln Heights neighborhood.[88]
A shooting during a large party wounded five people, including two juveniles.[85]
Eight people were shot, two fatally, at a large gathering of over 150 people in the Allendale neighborhood. Authorities believe multiple shooters were involved.[87]
Four men were injured when a fight escalated into a shooting near Western Michigan University. None of the victims were associated with the school.[86]

An argument in a parking lot escalated into a shooting when a man took another man's gun and opened fire, causing that man to take out a second weapon and return fire. A third person may have shot the man who returned fire, and five bystanders were wounded while the two men who fired shots at each other were killed.[84]
A shooting at a home killed one man and wounded four others.[83]
Five teenagers were shot and injured after a group of people arrived to fight at an apartment complex. A 15-year-old boy was taken into custody.[82]
A male juvenile was killed and three others were wounded in a shooting.[81]
Four people were injured in a shooting south of Alexandria.[80]
Four people were shot in a parking lot in Northeast Raleigh.[79]

2025 Southport shooting: A man on a boat coming up Cape Fear River opened fire on an outdoor bar on the shore of the Intracoastal Waterway, killing three people and wounding six others. A suspect was apprehended loading their boat at a public boat ramp in Oak Island to the west shortly afterwards.[77][78]

A person opened fire at the Kickapoo Lucky Eagle Casino in the Kickapoo Reservation during a raffle event late Saturday night, killing two people and injuring five others. The suspect fled and prompted a manhunt before being taken into custody in Wilson County.[75][76]
A drive-by shooting outside an apartment complex killed one person and wounded three others.[69]
Four people, including two juveniles, were shot outside an apartment complex as they played a game of dice.[70]

2025 Grand Blanc Township church attack: A man rammed a vehicle through the front doors of a Mormon church south of the city of Grand Blanc. The man then exited the vehicle and opened fire, killing two people and injuring five others before setting the church on fire. Responding officers shot and killed the gunman. In addition to the gunshot casualties, two people died from the fire and a further three suffered from smoke inhalation.[73][74]
An exchange of gunfire on Bourbon Street killed a female tourist and wounded three others. One of the shooters was also injured in the incident.[71][72]
Three men were shot and a woman was grazed by a bullet at an apartment complex in the Lindridge/Martin Manor neighborhood.[68]

Two children were killed and two others were critically injured in a shooting at a truck stop located off of Highway 288 and FM 521 near Angleton. The mother of the children was taken into custody and charged with murder.[66][67]
A shooting during a gathering of approximately 30 to 50 people behind a Speedway store killed one person and injured three others when an altercation broke out.[65]
2025 Montgomery shooting: Two people, including a teenager, were killed and 12 others were injured when two groups of people opened fire on each other in a crowd in Downtown Montgomery.[64]

An altercation in the parking lot of a nightclub in the Navco area escalated into a shooting which killed a man and wounded four others. The slain man is believed to have opened fire first, prompting another man to return fire, killing him.[63]
Four people were injured in a shooting at an apartment complex in the Talbot's Corner area of East Nashville.[62]
Multiple people opened fire inside a nightclub in the Cultural District, killing a man who was a known gang member, and injuring five others before fleeing.[61]
An altercation inside a bar in the Gateway District area of Downtown West escalated into a shooting that killed a man and injured three others.[60]
A shooting during a balloon release for a homicide victim in the Hamilton Heights neighborhood killed a man and injured four other men.[59]
Four people, including two teenagers, and a dog were shot in the Warren neighborhood.[58]

2025 Leland shooting: Following a homecoming high school football game, a shooting during a gathering in downtown Leland killed seven people and injured 18 others. Seven others also suffered non-gunshot injuries.[54][55][56][57]
Two security guards were killed and three others were injured when a fight at a bar escalated into a shooting during the early morning.[50][51]
An early morning shooting at a strip mall in East Dallas killed a man and wounded four others.[49]
Three men and a woman were shot as they sat in a vehicle together at an intersection in the Hilltop neighborhood.[48]
2025 Saint Helena Island shooting: Four people were killed and 16 others, four critically, were injured in a shooting at a bar on Saint Helena Island in the early morning hours.[52][53]
Three men and a woman were shot in a drive-by shooting in the Gold Coast area.[47]

A man shot five people, three fatally, at a home south of Mabank before driving into a Buc-ee's in Ennis and pinning a woman against a display. After coming to a stop, the man mortally wounded himself.[45][46]
A shooting involving rival motorcycle gangs outside of a Wawa convience store left six people injured.[44]
A fight at an apartment complex escalated into a shooting that wounded four.[43]
Three teenagers, one of whom died, and a woman were shot at an apartment complex.[42]
Two men were killed and two other men were injured from an early morning shooting at a Sunoco gas station in the Slavic Village neighborhood.[41]

Four people, including two teenagers, are suspected to have been shot by a man at a bonfire after a fight over a girl escalated into a shooting. A teenage girl suffered severe injuries that left her brain dead, and two days later she was taken off life support.[37][38][39]
Four people were injured in Old East Dallas when a person returned to a gathering they had been asked to leave and opened fire.[40]
Three juveniles and an adult were shot inside a vehicle overnight.[36]
Four men were injured in a late-evening drive-by shooting in Dover.[35]

Five people, including a teenager, were shot on the campus of Howard University during homecoming activities. None of the victims were students of the school, but one of the victims was a student of Morgan State University, whose football team was scheduled to play Howard University the following day.[33][34]
Thirteen people were shot at a large party in a rural area near Maxton. Two people were killed and several others were critically injured.[32]
A shooting during homecoming festivities at Lincoln University killed a person and injured six others during a tailgate and yardfest event near the school's football field.[31]
One person was killed and three others were injured in a shooting in the Gulfton neighborhood.[30]
A shooting at a house party stemming from an earlier altercation wounded five people.[29]

At least one person opened fire on the occupants of two vehicles in the area of McFerrin Park and Cleveland Park, resulting in four people being shot. At least one of the victims returned fire and one of the shot at vehicles crashed.[28]
Five juveniles were shot and injured at a Halloween party.[27]
Four teenagers were shot during a Halloween party at a home in the Central Los Angeles Heights neighborhood.[26]
Multiple people are believed to have opened fire during a memorial service for a homicide victim, killing one person and injuring four others.[21]
Four people were shot at an "illegal" Halloween party in the Natomas Creek neighborhood.[24]
Four people were shot, one fatally, when two people began shooting at each other outside a Dunkin' store. Police said all four of the victims were bystanders.[25]
Two teenagers were killed and two others were injured in a shooting during a large house party.[22][23]

Eight people, including several juveniles, were shot at a party being held at an Airbnb rental in Bath Township. A ninth person suffered a leg injury while fleeing the gunfire.[19] Four days later, a critically wounded teenage boy died from his injuries.[20]
Four people were shot in the Lake View neighborhood after a man allegedly got out of a pickup truck and opened fire on them.[18]
A shooting inside a bar killed a man and injured three others.[17]
Five people were shot in the Gateway neighborhood of northeast DC.[16]
A dispute outside a nightclub in the Over-The-Rhine neighborhood escalated into a shooting which injured four, including the owner's nephew.[15]
Four men were shot in the Winnetka neighborhood after another group of men in a car stopped, asked them where they were from, and then opened fire.[14]
Four men and a woman were shot in the Compton Village neighborhood.[13]
A fight in the area of Outer Richmond led to a shooting which wounded five people, including at least one teenager.[12]

An officer responding to a report of a domestic dispute was fired upon as he approached the home, wounding him, and the suspect escaped, sparking a manhunt. The suspect's grandfather and brother were found shot to death inside the home. Another officer was shot by the same suspect nearby overnight before the suspect was apprehended a few blocks away.[138]
